channel.title: Need help with a compiler error
channel.description:
PlayerHandler.java:473: error: ')' expected characterfile.write("character-Experience = ", Experience, 23); // S aves your Experience. ^ 1 error Files Compiled Successfully! Press any key to continue . . .
i got this error not sure how to fix
[code] characterfile.write("character-Experience = ", Experience, 23); // Saves your Experience. characterfile.write(Integer.toString(Experience), 0, Integer.toString(Experience).length()); characterfile.newLine();[/code]

item.title: Need help with a compiler error
item.dc:creator: @Daztech Daztech
item.description:
@Daztech wrote:

[quote=“luna-scape, post:5, topic:477496”]Why u put a " there?
Correct me if i am wron but after a " most of the time comes an )
Like
c.sendMessage(“lol”);

So i think something is wrong with the code[/quote]
i fixed it, there was no problem with that code, it was some other code that interfiered with the code and the compiler dint show it.

Read full topic

Why u put a " there?
Correct me if i am wron but after a " most of the time comes an )
Like
c.sendMessage(“lol”);

So i think something is wrong with the code

item.title: Need help with a compiler error
item.dc:creator: @Daztech Daztech
item.description:
@Daztech wrote:

xI c E:

It’s something else within the method that’s causing the error, that piece of code is fine.

yes your probably right because it dint fix it instead it game me 4more errors, they are probably the old ones.

item.title: Need help with a compiler error
item.dc:creator: @OGolemX OGolemX
item.description:
@OGolemX wrote:

Dude you got to do what the compiler tells you. Since its saying ‘)’ expected you nee to put another ) so here, ill rewrite your code underneath this.

characterfile.write("character-Experience = ", Experience, 23))

That should work. But if it still gives an error or something, use this code. But use the first one first.

characterfile.write("character-Experience = ", Experience, 23));

Its almost for sure that one of them will work since today i had exactly the same error but i was making something else then that.

Ps. Read what your compiler said to do, there was an ^ arrow pointing where you needed to put the ‘)’
Kk thanks
Good luck with it
-Owner GolemX
(owner of GolemXScape, thats why i posted owner and btw im not advertisin my server, thats just my name)

Read full topic
